title.narrative: Strengthening the participation and representation of older people in Uganda

description.narrative: The programme aims to build the capacity of newly elected older people representatives and older people community leaders. Older Ugandans, who are over 60 years of age and constitute approximately 1.3 million people, face numerous challenges such as limited access to services, age discrimination, and societal marginalization. The 2016 national elections will for the first time include a ballot choice for district councilors that will specifically represent older Ugandans. Each district will hence have two older person representatives, one male and one female, who will be part of the district government. There will also be elections for eight regional representatives who will make up what will be a newly established institution of the National Council of Older Persons. HelpAge, in partnership with Uganda Reach the Aged Association (URRA), seeks to build the capacity of the newly elected district and national representatives of older people in order to strengthen their ability to represent the interests of their constituents and ensure that governance and economic concerns of older people are adequately addressed. The organization will also strengthen the capacity of local community based associations, specifically older citizen monitoring groups (OCMG) and older people's associations (OPA), so that they can hold their newly elected representatives accountable.

To strengthen 24 Older Citizen Monitoring Groups and Older Person Association leaders in the same 12 districts enabling them to hold government officials accountable, and to track and monitor access and participation of older persons in service delivery and democratic processes.

To strengthen the capacity of 24 District Councilors of Older Persons District Councilors (2 from 12 districts) and 8 members of the National Council of Older Persons enabling them to effectively represent older persons in the district councils.
iii. To increase awareness and understanding of the government's policies for older people among older people, policy implementers and the general public in the project area.
